definition: (of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume

sentences.english: The 1961 law forbidding dowries further undermined traditional Hinduism.
sentences.chinese: 1961年，法律更進一步地破壞印度教傳統的嫁妝。

sentences.english: A beautiful girl , though poor indeed, is yet abundantly dowered .
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的姑娘即使貧窮也等天擁有了豐富的嫁妝。

sentences.english: The bride brought many dowries to her husband.
sentences.chinese: 新娘帶着很多嫁妝給她丈夫。

sentences.english: I only need to save up for the dowry, which is manageable.
sentences.chinese: 我只需要給他存嫁妝錢了，這就比較好辦了。

sentences.english: Parents cannot afford quinceañeras for their daughters.
sentences.chinese: 父母無法支付女兒們的嫁妝。

sentences.english: The chest was made for a bride's trousseau.
sentences.chinese: 這個櫃子是爲新娘的嫁妝而做的。

sentences.english: A bride's parents often buy a whole set of white goods as a dowry.
sentences.chinese: 新娘的父母通常都買一整套的家用電器作爲嫁妝陪嫁。

sentences.english: Moreover had just bought the road tiger, that is prepares to give daughter's trousseau .
sentences.chinese: 另外剛買了輛路虎，那是準備送給女兒的嫁妝。

sentences.english: All of Dai Niangs is 72 lift of trousseau, you say text son tin the this place be obtaining worse?
sentences.chinese: 黛娘都是七十二擡的嫁妝，你說文兒這邊能差了嗎？

sentences.english: My father portioned the car to my sister's fiance for the dowry.
sentences.chinese: 我父親送給我妹妹的未婚夫一輛汽車作爲嫁妝。
這些都是新娘子的嫁妝啊。

sentences.english: I wonder if the dowry depends on tonnage?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，難道嫁妝取決於噸位嗎？

sentences.english: Therefore, Yin Sha's lover Da Long can't have the approval to marry Yin Sha.
sentences.chinese: 銀沙戀人大龍出不起嫁妝不能與銀沙成婚。

sentences.english: The ex- wife's trousseau all of me handed over to elder sister son.
sentences.chinese: 前太太的嫁妝我全都交給大姐兒了。

sentences.english: And I think I'll buy your trousseau for you, too.
It is believed that three poor sisters could not marry because they had no money for a dowry.
sentences.chinese: 據說有三個姐妹因爲沒錢辦嫁妝而不能結婚。

definition: to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
to carry on one's ancestral line
the families are well-matched in terms of social status (idiom)/(of a prospective marriage partner) an appropriate match
to support a family/to raise a family
